intro: Habranthus lacteus, commonly known as the milky bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a distinguishing feature and can be toxic if ingested. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The leaves are lance-shaped and evergreen, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
